content.en: Variational Inequality Algorithms: Researchers have proposed various algorithms to solve different types of variational inequality problems. These algorithms are designed to find solutions without prior knowledge of certain constants, such as the Lipschitz constant. The algorithms use techniques like variable stepsizes, regularization, projections, and inertial effects to achieve convergence and find the minimum-norm solution. The research focuses on analyzing the convergence and effectiveness of these algorithms for solving variational inequality problems.
content.da: Variationsulighedsalgoritmer: Forskere har foreslået forskellige algoritmer til at løse forskellige typer af variationsulighedsproblemer. Disse algoritmer er designet til at finde løsninger uden forudgående kendskab til bestemte konstanter, såsom Lipschitz-konstanten. Algoritmerne anvender teknikker som variable skridtlængder, regularisering, projektioner og inertielle effekter for at opnå konvergens og finde minimumsnormsløsningen. Forskningen fokuserer på at analysere konvergensen og effektiviteten af disse algoritmer til at løse variationsulighedsproblemer.
